data.title: Northern Alberta producers not part of CWB! - Farming and Agriculture Discussion Forum
data.meta_description: Commodity Marketing - join the discussion forums on commodity marketing and more at Agriville.com
data.text:
Charlie,

I noticed this message and wanted to listen... BUT: We are not a part of the CWB!

"Newsroom

The CWB report

On May 13, CWB weather analyst Stuart McMillan discusses the U.S. winter wheat outlook and his recent crop surveillance tours to Oklahoma. "The CWB Report" airs on Goldenwest Radio stations across the Prairies. Join the CWB and farm broadcaster Kelvin Heppner on Wednesdays for 12 weeks during the seeding and harvest seasons. This four-minute interview features CWB experts sharing current information with producers on topics such as crop outlooks and CWB programs. Successful farming comes down to what you know about what you grow.

The show runs on:

CHRB 1140 High River, AB at 1:21 p.m.

CFYM 1330 Kindersley, SK at 2:06 p.m.

CJYM 1330 Rosetown, SK at 2:06 p.m.

CFSL 1190 Weyburn, SK at 12:28 p.m.

CJSL 1280 Estevan, SK at 12:38 p.m.

CKSW 570 Swift Current, SK at 5:55 p.m.

CJSN 1490 Shaunavon, SK at 5:55 p.m.

CFAM 950 Altona, MB at 1:49 p.m.

CHSM 1250 Steinbach, MB at 1:49 p.m.

CJRB 1220 Boissevain, MB at 1:49 p.m.

CFRY 920 Portage la Prairie, MB at 1:45 p.m."

http://www.cwb.ca/public/en/newsroom/report/

Are there any radio stations in Northern Alberta that are part of the GoldenWest network?

Is the weekly commentary in question paid for by the CWB or is a public service announcement arranged for and paid for by GoldenWest? And if so, does GoldenWest have the exclusive rights to the broadcast?

If not were any radio stations in Northern Alberta approached to carry the information? If so why did they not do so? No time available when the CWB felt farmers were listening? Costs much higher than Golden West? .....

How much of GoldenWest does the CWB own as you claim?

Dear Charlie,

WHY DOES the CWB keep the dollars for "carry in the market"?

IE Dec 09 vs Mar 10 Futures:

US Futures /CDN per T /CDN price

Dec. 09 $7.08 $303.24 $8.25

Mar. 10 $7.18 $307.52 $8.37

If I plan to deliver after Dec futures expire... and planned to do so in advance... why should the CWB keep my money for the carry in the market?
